channel.title: Port forwarding question GET REWARDET
channel.description: hello guys, got small problem, I portforwardet my router (192.168.1.1) then I opened port mopar 43594 - 43594 [192.168.1.##] i did ipconfig to get it. save .. I opened my firewall addet mopar with port 43594. This is what I did Can anyone tell me what I did wrong? (And no its not my anti-virus dubble checked that) All this worked before. [b]Rep points for the one who can solve this problem.[/b] grtz

item.title: Port forwarding question GET REWARDET
item.dc:creator: @samskswanch samskswanch
item.description:
@samskswanch wrote:

i did all this any times and i just did it again but friends cant connect. how do i make sure server port is right?

Read full topic

item.title: Port forwarding question GET REWARDET
item.dc:creator: @durial12 durial12
item.description:
@durial12 wrote:

Follow a guide for your router on www.portforward.com <---- portforward helped me do mine…but just change ports to 43594. And the ip you forward to looks like 192.169.1.xxx, not 92.xx.xx.xx. It took me about 2 weeks to figure it out, and remember, you cannot log in to your server with the IP or NO-IP, for you it will need to be 0.0.0.0, try asking someone else to try and log in, thats what I did

Hope this helps.

Ed

Read full topic

item.title: Port forwarding question GET REWARDET
item.dc:creator: @durial12 durial12
item.description:
@durial12 wrote:

thats a bad idea. People could now eisily get into your computer through an open port with no firewall to stop them

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“ollie123, post:6, topic:312339”]Did you add your computer’s IP address to the port forward in your router?

item.title: Port forwarding question GET REWARDET
item.dc:creator: @durial12 durial12
item.description:
@durial12 wrote:

Well, all I can suggest is to check your Local IP and also make sure the Portforward Rule is “saving” properly in your router settings.

Read full topic

item.title: Port forwarding question GET REWARDET
item.dc:creator: @ballin2005 ballin2005
item.description:
@ballin2005 wrote:

[quote=“reverce, post:3, topic:312339”][quote author=ballin2005 link=topic=408744.msg3017090#msg3017090 date=1257278256]
Try shutting down the firewall and try again.
Idk if this will work but it’s worth the try. Try making a “no-ip”.
Are you sure the port ur server is under 43594?
It may seem like a long process but if you call your Internet provider they will guide you on port forwarding free off charge, try that as a last resort.
[/quote]
I tryed with the firewal before,
I got non ip
yes i’am sure the port is under 43594.
Not planning to call to my internet provider like hello how do i host my illigal server?

thank you for your response.[/quote]
Lol, that’s how I went about when I couldn’t find the problem. You really don’t hav to tell them anything but the port number…

Read full topic

item.title: Port forwarding question GET REWARDET
item.dc:creator: @ballin2005 ballin2005
item.description:
@ballin2005 wrote:

Try shutting down the firewall and try again.
Idk if this will work but it’s worth the try. Try making a “no-ip”.
Are you sure the port ur server is under 43594?
It may seem like a long process but if you call your Internet provider they will guide you on port forwarding free off charge, try that as a last resort.
